module.p:
suidh caileag a girl sits down –
An do shuidh a’ chaileag aig an teine? Shuidh.
Did the girl sit down by the fire? Yes, she did. td. 237

suidh ... air cathair ... sits down on a chair –
Càir an do shuidh Calum? Shuidh Calum air a’ chathair.
Where did Malcolm sit down? Malcolm sat down on the chair. td. 47

suidh ... air cnoc ... sits down on a hill –
Shuidh iad air a’ chnoc.
They sat down on the hill. td. 47

suidh ... air tolman ... sits down on a hillock –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. Thug Seumas leis an t-slat-iasgaich agus thug Màiri leatha biadh ann am bascaid. [...] Nuair a bha an t-acras orra, shuidh iad air tolman agus ghabh iad am biadh a bha aig Màiri anns a’ bhascaid.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. James took the fishing rod with him and Mary took (with her) food in a basket. [...] When they were hungry, they sat down on a hillock and they took the food that Mary had in the basket. td. 76

suidh ... aig teine ... sits down by a fire –
Suidh aig an teine!.
Sit down by the fire! td. 237
An do shuidh a’ chaileag aig an teine? Shuidh.
Did the girl sit down by the fire? Yes, she did. td. 237

suidh ... ri taobh cùirn ... ... sits down beside a cairn –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. Bha càrn chlach air mullach na beinne. Chuir Calum clach air a’ chàrn agus shuidh e ri taobh a’ chùirn a’ leigeil analach.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. There was a cairn of stones on the top of the mountain. Calum put a stone onto the cairn and he sat down beside the cairn having a rest. td. 146
